title: American Eagle Outfitters Is Showing ‘Signs of Panic’ and the Stock Is Slumping
text:
American Eagle Outfitters stock was slumping Monday afternoon, after Citigroup downgraded the teen-apparel retailer, warning that its near-term outlook looks more challenging.

The back story. American Eagle shares (ticker: AEO) have slipped 16% in 2019, badly trailing both the S&P 500, up 20.5%, and the struggling retail sector, as the SDPR S&P Retail ETF (XRT) has still carved out 8% gains year to date. Last month the shares took a hit when the company provided disappointing guidance, which overshadowed a stronger-than-expected...
description: Citi analyst Paul Lejuez downgraded American Eagle to Neutral from Buy, and lowered is price target by $3, to $17. He said he sees risks to near-term estimates.
